details.description: Phishing Alert: Malicious emails and websites attempting to login to email accounts with incorrect credentials.
recommendations: Always ensure the URL in the address bar is exactly https://email.gov.in when entering credentials.
Do not open attachments in unsolicited emails, even if they come from people in your contact list.
Exercise caution when opening e-mail attachments even if the attachment is expected and the sender appears to be known.
Inform the security team of the organization, if any suspicious mails, files etc. are received.
details.conclusion: You are advised to follow best practices to protect your networks and information from similar attacks.

name: Phishing Alert
details: Always ensure that the URL in the address bar is exactly https://email.gov.in whenever you are entering your credentials for the website.
Do not open attachments in unsolicited e-mails, even if they come from people in your contact list. Never click on a URL contained in an unsolicited email, even if the link seems benign.

Exercise caution when opening e-mail attachments even if the attachment is expected and the sender appears to be known. Scan for and remove suspicious e-mail attachments; ensure the scanned attachment is its "true file type" (i.e. the extension matches the file header).
Inform the security team of the organization, if any suspicious mails, files etc. are received.
In cases of genuine URLs, close the e-mail and go to the organization's website directly through browser's address bar.
Leverage Pretty Good Privacy (PGP) in mail communications. Additionally, it is advised to encrypt / protect the sensitive documents stored in the internet facing machines to avoid potential leakage.
Check the integrity of URLs before providing login credentials or clicking a link. Do not submit personal information to unknown and unfamiliar websites.
Beware of emails and webpages providing special offers like winning prize, rewards, cashback offers etc.
Consider using Safe Browsing tools, filtering tools (antivirus and content-based filtering) in your antivirus, firewall, and filtering services.
Update spam filters with latest spam mail contents.
If you suspect to have been phished, change the password immediately and inform the mail administrator.
